name: FIN13
descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) is a financially motivated cyber threat group that has targeted the financial, retail, and hospitality industries in Mexico and Latin America, as early as 2016. [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) achieves its objectives by stealing intellectual property, financial data, mergers and acquisition information, or PII.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Make and Impersonate Token
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has utilized tools such as Incognito V2 for token manipulation and impersonation.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Account Discovery

subtechniques.name: Domain Account
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) can identify user accounts associated with a Service Principal Name and query Service Principal Names within the domain by utilizing the following scripts: `GetUserSPNs.vbs` and `querySpn.vbs`.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has enumerated all users and their roles from a victim's main treasury system.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

subtechniques.name: Additional Local or Domain Groups
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has assigned newly created accounts the sysadmin role to maintain persistence.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Web Protocols
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has used HTTP requests to chain multiple web shells and to contact actor-controlled C2 servers prior to exfiltrating stolen data.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Archive via Utility
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has compressed the dump output of compromised credentials with a 7zip binary.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has used Windows Registry run keys such as, `HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\hosts` to maintain persistence.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

subtechniques.name: PowerShell
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has used PowerShell commands to obtain DNS data from a compromised network.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

subtechniques.name: Windows Command Shell
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has leveraged `xp_cmdshell` and Windows Command Shell to execute commands on a compromised machine. [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has also attempted to leverage the ‘xp_cmdshell’ SQL procedure to execute remote commands on internal MS-SQL servers.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Visual Basic
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has used VBS scripts for code execution on comrpomised machines.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Local Account
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has created MS-SQL local accounts in a compromised network.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Data from Local System
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has gathered stolen credentials, sensitive data such as point-of-sale (POS), and ATM data from a compromised network before exfiltration.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Data Manipulation
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has injected fraudulent transactions into compromised networks that mimic legitimate behavior to siphon off incremental amounts of money.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Local Data Staging
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has utilized the following temporary folders on compromised Windows and Linux systems for their operations prior to exfiltration: `C:\Windows\Temp` and `/tmp`.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has utilized `certutil` to decode base64 encoded versions of custom malware.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

subtechniques.name: Malware
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has utilized custom malware to maintain persistence in a compromised environment.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has exploited known vulnerabilities such as CVE-2017-1000486 (Primefaces Application Expression Language Injection), CVE-2015-7450 (WebSphere Application Server SOAP Deserialization Exploit), CVE-2010-5326 (SAP NewWeaver Invoker Servlet Exploit), and EDB-ID-24963 (SAP NetWeaver ConfigServlet Remote Code Execution) to gain initial access.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: External Remote Services
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has gained access to compromised environments via remote access services such as the corporate virtual private network (VPN).(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

technique_table_data.name: File and Directory Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has used the Windows `dir` command to enumerate files and directories in a victim's network.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Financial Theft
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has observed the victim's software and infrastructure over several months to understand the technical process of legitimate financial transactions, prior to attempting to conduct fraudulent transactions.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Gather Victim Identity Information
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has researched employees to target for social engineering attacks.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

subtechniques.name: Network Topology
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has searched for infrastructure that can provide remote access to an environment for targeting efforts.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

subtechniques.name: Hidden Files and Directories
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has created hidden files and folders within a compromised Linux system `/tmp` directory. [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) also has used `attrib.exe` to hide gathered local host information.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: DLL
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has used IISCrack.dll as a side-loading technique to load a malicious version of httpodbc.dll on old IIS Servers (CVE-2001-0507).(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has downloaded additional tools and malware to compromised systems.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Keylogging
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has logged the keystrokes of victims to escalate privileges.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Masquerading

subtechniques.name: Masquerade Task or Service
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has used scheduled tasks names such as `acrotyr` and `AppServicesr` to mimic the same names in a compromised network's `C:\Windows` directory.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

subtechniques.name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has masqueraded WAR files to look like legitimate packages such as, wsexample.war, wsexamples.com, examples.war, and exampl3s.war.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has masqueraded staged data by using the Windows [certutil](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0160) utility to generate fake Base64 encoded certificates with the input file.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Modify Authentication Process
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has replaced legitimate KeePass binaries with trojanized versions to collect passwords from numerous applications.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Network Service Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has utilized `nmap` for reconnaissance efforts. [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has also scanned for internal MS-SQL servers in a compromised network.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Network Share Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has executed net view commands for enumeration of open shares on compromised machines.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Tool
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has utilized publicly available tools such as [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002), [Impacket](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0357), PWdump7, ProcDump, Nmap, and Incognito V2 for targeting efforts.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: LSASS Memory
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has obtained memory dumps with ProcDump to parse and extract credentials from a victim's LSASS process memory with [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002).(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Security Account Manager
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has extracted the SAM and SYSTEM registry hives using the `reg.exe` binary for obtaining password hashes from a compromised machine.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: NTDS
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has harvested the NTDS.DIT file and leveraged the [Impacket](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0357) tool on the compromised domain controller to locally decrypt it.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Permission Groups Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has enumerated all users and roles from a victim's main treasury system.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Protocol Tunneling
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has utilized web shells and Java tools for tunneling capabilities to and from compromised assets.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Internal Proxy
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has utilized a proxy tool to communicate between compromised assets.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has remotely accessed compromised environments via Remote Desktop Services (RDS) for lateral movement.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

subtechniques.name: SMB/Windows Admin Shares
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has leveraged SMB to move laterally within a compromised network via application servers and SQL servers.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: SSH
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has remotely accessed compromised environments via secure shell (SSH) for lateral movement.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

subtechniques.name: Windows Remote Management
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has leveraged `WMI` to move laterally within a compromised network via application servers and SQL servers.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Scheduled Task
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has created scheduled tasks in the `C:\Windows` directory of the compromised network.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

subtechniques.name: Web Shell
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has utilized obfuscated and open-source web shells such as JspSpy, reGeorg, MiniWebCmdShell, and Vonloesch Jsp File Browser 1.2 to enable remote code execution and to execute commands on compromised web server.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: System Information Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has collected local host information by utilizing Windows commands `systeminfo`, `fsutil`, and `fsinfo`. [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has also utilized a compromised Symantex Altiris console and LanDesk account to retrieve host information.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has used `nslookup` and `ipconfig` for network reconnaissance efforts. [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has also utilized a compromised Symantec Altiris console and LanDesk account to retrieve network information.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Internet Connection Discovery
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has used `Ping` and `tracert` for network reconnaissance efforts.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

technique_table_data.name: System Network Connections Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has used `netstat` and other net  commands for network reconnaissance efforts.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

subtechniques.name: Credentials In Files
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has obtained administrative credentials by browsing through local files on a compromised machine.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Pass the Hash
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has used the PowerShell utility `Invoke-SMBExec` to execute the pass the hash method for lateral movement within an compromised environment.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)

subtechniques.name: Default Accounts
subtechniques.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has leveraged default credentials for authenticating myWebMethods (WMS) and QLogic web management interface to gain initial access.(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN13](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1016) has utilized `WMI` to execute commands and move laterally on compromised Windows machines.(Citation: Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022)(Citation: Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022)

techniques.name: Hijack Execution Flow
techniques.sub_name: Path Interception by Search Order Hijacking

techniques.name: Hijack Execution Flow
techniques.sub_name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable

Sygnia Elephant Beetle Jan 2022.description: Sygnia Incident Response Team. (2022, January 5). TG2003: ELEPHANT BEETLE UNCOVERING AN ORGANIZED FINANCIAL-THEFT OPERATION. Retrieved February 9, 2023.

Mandiant FIN13 Aug 2022.description: Ta, V., et al. (2022, August 8). FIN13: A Cybercriminal Threat Actor Focused on Mexico. Retrieved February 9, 2023.
